channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024070576
item.description:
Report E-2024070576

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) due to a load shift that crushed one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel clean the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070516
item.description:
Report E-2024070516

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a small puncture in the body of the drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerize the recovered spent absorbents and the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight ’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070515
item.description:
Report E-2024070515

  • City: KENT
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) liter of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jerrycan due to a load shift during transit. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area, and the cleanup debris was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the damaged jerrycan. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070110
item.description:
Report E-2024070110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MARION
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 33ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to crushed freight due to hard braking damaging twelve (12) plastic bottles. First Call personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the neutralized material. The spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged bottles were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest ESTES terminal. The damaged bottles were then combined with the spent absorbents. The 55-gallon poly drum was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor’s demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071052
item.description:
Report X-2024071052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MIAMISBURG

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: We found it on the rollers between door 17 and 18 as it had been put with the regular closures during the sort. The box was already dry when we received it, but we had not found any other boxes that it had leaked on to. There were two jugs of Zep industrial degreaser and one of them had no cap, so the degreaser had leaked out at some point.

item.title: Report E-2024070426
item.description:
Report E-2024070426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown quantity of Urkisol 500 released from several 1-gallon metal cans impacting the pallet and trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents if necessary and place the contents into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070400
item.description:
Report E-2024070400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 2-gallons of Tremco Puma TC (hazardous - UN1866) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 10-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report I-2024070057
item.description:
Report I-2024070057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: Defiance
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to delvier a shipment of Ferric Chloride to Defiance Water in Defiance, OH. The driver arrived on site, proceeded to the offloading location, and hooked up to the customers tank. During the offload the customer's PVC piping failed resulting in 20 gallons of Ferric Chloride to be released within containment.

item.title: Report I-2024060050
item.description:
Report I-2024060050

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A release was observed from the nose of a drum trailer. The source was investigated and discovered to originate from two 5-gallon containers that had fallen onto their sides during transport. The release was contained to prevent additional loss of material. Both containers were overpacked and clean up residuals were placed into new containers.

item.title: Report I-2024060042
item.description:
Report I-2024060042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver unloaded material using two hoses. The coupler was made of the wrong material for the product being delivered. Duration of the release was less than 15 seconds. Driver engaged the emergency shut off and stopped the flow.
